data.title: Mount Calvary woman gets 30 days in jail for stealing poppy sales money from the American Legion
data.meta_description: The money from poppy sales was discovered missing back in the summer of 2017. The annual fundraiser supports both the Legion and its auxiliary.
data.text:
FOND DU LAC - A Mount Calvary woman was ordered to serve 30 days in jail and two years of probation for stealing poppy sales money from veterans.

Donna Wilhelms, 65, pleaded no contest Tuesday to three counts of felony theft from a business setting. Fond du Lac County Circuit Court Judge Gary Sharpe also ordered Wilhelms pay back $10,660 in restitution money during the duration of her probation.

Members of American Legion Auxiliary Post 75 contacted police in the summer of 2017 to report missing money from a poppy flower sale they hold every year as a fundraiser.

Profits from the sale are split in half between the auxiliary and the Legion post.

Wilhelms was the Fond du Lac County Legion Treasurer at the time.

Police detectives discovered most of the money deposited into an American Legion Auxiliary account at Marine Credit Union would be withdrawn from the account shortly after it was deposited, draining the account, court records state.

Wilhelms later confessed to taking checks written out to the American Legion, depositing them, then withdrawing cash for her own personal use.

It's estimated at least $7,500 was withdrawn between June 2013 and December 2016.

Wilhelms told detectives she was having financial difficulties.

Sharpe ordered the defendant write a letter of apology and serve 30 hours of community service.

RELATED: FDL County Courthouse will be secured on Aug. 5
